definition: to speak/to explain/to negotiate/to emphasise/to be particular about/as far as sth is concerned/speech/lecture

sentences.english: Lansdorp also mentioned that he'd visited Spartak last year to teach a clinic.
sentences.chinese: 羅伯特還提到他去年參觀過斯巴達克，並在那裏講學。

sentences.english: Chenbaisha, who developed the neo-Confucianism here in Ming-dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 明代理學家陳白沙也曾在此講學。

sentences.english: So take a quarter of time speaking progress, will study.
sentences.chinese: 所以多花一節的時間來講進步，講學習。

sentences.english: We'll be looking at vocabulary and collocations related to office duties and daily routines.
sentences.chinese: 我們講學習辦公責任和例行公事的詞彙及其搭配。

sentences.english: First of all, talk about learning.
One disciple always sat through each session in silence.
sentences.chinese: 有一個弟子在每一次講學中都保持沉默。

sentences.english: Chao acted as interpreter when Bertrand Russell took a lecture tour of China.
sentences.chinese: 當年英國哲學家羅素來華巡迴講學，趙元任擔任翻譯。

sentences.english: I go around the world lecturing, and they pay me well.
sentences.chinese: 我到世界各地講學，他們付我很好。

sentences.english: He earned a lot of extra income for himself by taking classes on the side.
sentences.chinese: 同時，通過開課講學，他還會有額外的收入。

sentences.english: This seems to be, in many ways, the essence of his teaching.
sentences.chinese: 從很多層面看來，這看似他講學的精義所在。

sentences.english: One day Shoun left for a distant temple to deliver a lecture.
sentences.chinese: 一天，正安前往遠方的寺廟講學。

sentences.english: At the time, Shue said she would eventually like to teach and make documentaries.
sentences.chinese: 當時，Shue說她將會最終願意講學和製作紀錄片。

sentences.english: We'll start / begin a new lesson today.
According to the legend, Xing tan is Confucius's lecture place.
sentences.chinese: 杏壇相傳是孔子講學的地方。

definition: to seek knowledge/to study/to attend college
junior scholar or pupil in imperial China
Chinese national culture/studies of ancient Chinese civilization/the Imperial College (history)
Hu Shi (1891-1962), original proponent of writing in colloquial Chinese 白話文|白话文[bai2 hua4 wen2]
to study away from home or abroad (old)
scholarship/high-level study/to do scholarly research/to pursue a high level of study
